content: Did anyone saw ''special'' deals hardware wallets offered for Aprils 1st 2023?First one I saw was from Keystone and it was called CryptoBreathalyzer , that was giving 100% gains in just one day! The CryptoBreathalyzer uses advanced sensor technology to measure the amount of alcohol in your breath, and it can analyze your breath to determine  level of confidence and provide real-time feedback on trading decisions.https://twitter.com/KeystoneWallet/status/1641833421310939136Second special devices was posted by Foundation Devices and it was called Pasport Stun,  that was offering protection against $5 wrench attacks This device can be used by people for protection from other attacks, or for getting people shocked.https://twitter.com/FOUNDATIONdvcs/status/1642205412899315712Trezor released brand new April 1st device called Trezor Staxxx, coldest, most stable self-custody ever created.It is so cold that is has to be stacked and kept in fridge.https://twitter.com/Trezor/status/1642184531850547207?cxt=HHwWjsC-ybGIm8otAAAANothing released from Ledger, but I am counting Ledger Nono X as their April 1st device for year 2023  Does anyone know about any other ''special'' hardware wallets released on April 1st?Note: If you want to purchase any of this devices you will have to pass KYC verification, send me your blood type, photos of your girlfriend/s, your credit card info, and I will consider selling them to you for special April 1 discount price.

Blockstream released "this" for Jade but having said that, the more I'm reading about it [e.g. here's one], the more I think this might actually be true [can someone confirm if it really works]!

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on April 03, 2023, 10:53:44 PMTrezor released brand new April 1st device called Trezor Staxxx, coldest, most stable self-custody ever created.It is so cold that is has to be stacked and kept in fridge.https://twitter.com/Trezor/status/1642184531850547207?cxt=HHwWjsC-ybGIm8otAAAAVery funny, especially since people really tend to keep important stuff like money in the freezer somehow.   Would be interesting to see if the devices are still working at these temperatures.The Ledger Nano X is really not that great, especially for that kind of money…

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on April 03, 2023, 10:53:44 PMWhile Trezor staxxx looks like a weak attempt to mock the name of one competitor product, the fridge part is nice.But the Passport Stun looks much more convincing!  I do like it Quote from: hZti on April 05, 2023, 06:16:00 PMThe Ledger Nano X is really not that great, especially for that kind of money…It's No-No X, just go and read again. With the continuous list of problems of those, they are a perpetual April 1 (bad) joke. I think that this was OP's point.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I don't know how I managed to miss these silly "offers" on April 1th.I personally like the Passport edit, because it looks like something which some eccentric company could actually offer to some also eccentric crypto holders.The Trezor one is rather lazy, in my opinion, they could have at least tried to make a small case of a prototype to fool more people in a more convincing way, but at least they tried. Ironically, it would have had more of an impact on those who wish Satoshilabs to reveal their newest generation of HW. It was a lost chance, honestly. Do not be so serious, SL.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on April 03, 2023, 10:53:44 PMDid anyone saw ''special'' deals hardware wallets offered for Aprils 1st 2023?~snipNo, I haven't seen it and it's the first time I hear about it. Although these funny announcements can be used as a kind of way to promote their products. Why did they think of this before?Funny April 1st announcements were made by these HW device manufacturers and as you noticed, Ledger could not come up with anything original. Which is rather strange, since this company has a lot of resources and could use the holiday for advertising purposes. Well, or just to please their fans.The rest of the companies, of which there are quite a lot, also didn't have anything like this in social networks?

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on April 03, 2023, 10:53:44 PMSecond special devices was posted by Foundation Devices and it was called Pasport Stun,  that was offering protection against $5 wrench attacks This device can be used by people for protection from other attacks, or for getting people shocked.In all seriousness, I think people with large amounts of crypto should be carrying around one of these.Shock batons are a good defense against $5 wrench attacks, but it's impractical to put it in a hardware wallet because it uses the entire charge to zap the adversary, meaning it has to be recharged after you use it.For extra safety, also keep a pistol lying around the house in a secure location.

comments.author: PawGo
comments.body: Quote from: m2017 on April 09, 2023, 02:35:25 PMFunny April 1st announcements were made by these HW device manufacturers and as you noticed, Ledger could not come up with anything original. It's the other way around. They whole offer is like a one big April 1st, the other companies had to do an extra effort to be at the same level.But yes, honestly speaking I think HWs are overpriced and any reason (even April 1st) would be a good reason to make a discount promo. After all, the cheaper HWs are, the more popular they become.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on April 11, 2023, 07:02:49 AMIn all seriousness, I think people with large amounts of crypto should be carrying around one of these. An axe to the shoulder blade or spine tends to be quite effective as well. Quote from: NotATether on April 11, 2023, 07:02:49 AMFor extra safety, also keep a pistol lying around the house in a secure location.  If you have a gun, it should go everywhere you go. More precisely, everywhere you sleep. It's not much of a use if you have to walk past the thief on your way from your bedroom to your living room to get to your gun. Or the stories you hear about people taking it apart and keeping different parts in separate rooms of the house. Wait a little Mr. robber. I just need to get my stuff and I will be right with you.

comments.body: Keystone continues with their special April hardware wallet editions.Now they introduced special Iris Recognition Recovery Phrase, so you can recover your recovery phrase using your eyes... very convenient.Ledger posted Monopoly playing with their devices and stacking sats:I didn't saw other hardware wallet manufacturers doing something similar this year, but maybe I just missed it.I did saw Gnosis Pay card posting about Gnosis Pay Body Chip.

comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on April 01, 2025, 08:05:28 PMI didn't saw other hardware wallet manufacturers doing something similar this year, but maybe I just missed it.Perhaps the following HW manufacturers made their announcements after you created this post:- SecuX introduced SecuX Pet Wallet as "the world's first cold wallet designed for pets".- D'Cent released a Crystal edition that comes with "unexpected airdrops" as its side effect; note that it's not FDA approved!- ERA Wallet added "AI Voice Control".- Foundation Devices introduced "Passport Ink [they claim it's unhackable ]" and it comes with a free mirror.

comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on April 02, 2025, 08:54:40 PMThanks for contribution and finding this!I didn't saw anything you posted but I am not following all those accounts and I am not hanging on twitter very often.Foundation was funny with Passport ink skin backups, there is no chance of forgetting them  You're very welcome and thanks as well for posting the other ones the other day... comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on April 03, 2023, 10:53:44 PMNothing released from Ledger, but I am counting Ledger Nono X as their April 1st device for year 2023  It seems to me that any device released by Ledger is by default an April Fool's joke, therefore, April 1st doesn't need any separate announcements on this day.This joke (is this really a joke?) suggests itself.Quote from: NotATether on April 11, 2023, 07:02:49 AMShock batons are a good defense against $5 wrench attacks, but it's impractical to put it in a hardware wallet because it uses the entire charge to zap the adversary, meaning it has to be recharged after you use it.It seems to me that everything is just the opposite. Pasport Stun will be used as an alternative to $5 wrench attacks. 1st, the attacker will use this shocker against the owner, and then the owner will voluntarily enter all the necessary pin codes.
